item.title: Ellen add a quote by Mary South
item.description: "Adventure comes with no guarantees or promises. Risk and reward are conjoined twins—and that’s why my favorite piece of advice needs translation but no disclaimers: Fortes fortuna juvat. ‘Fortune favors the brave,’ the ancient Roman dramatist Terrence declared. In other words, there are many good reasons not to toss your life up in the air and see how it lands. Just don’t let fear be one of them." -- Mary South

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "It's not how much we give but how much love we put into giving." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "There is nothing like returning to a place that remains unchanged to find the ways in which you yourself have altered." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If you have built castles in the air, your work need not be lost; that is where they should be. Now put the foundations under them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Benjamin E Mays
item.description: "It must be borne in mind that the tragedy of life doesn’t lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goal to reach. It isn’t a calamity to die with dreams unfulfilled, but it is a calamity not to dream. It is not a disaster to be unable to capture your ideal, but it is a disaster to have no ideal to capture. It is not a disgrace not to reach the stars, but it is a disgrace to have no stars to reach for. Not failure, but low aim is sin." -- Benjamin E Mays

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "In the councils of government, we must guard against the acquisition of unwarranted influence, whether sought or unsought, by the military industrial complex. The potential for the disastrous rise of misplaced power exists and will persist. We must never let the weight of this combination endanger our liberties or democratic processes. We should take nothing for granted. Only an alert and knowledgeable citizenry can compel the proper meshing of the huge industrial and military machinery of defense with our peaceful methods and goals, so that security and liberty may prosper together." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower

item.title: Ellen add a quote by John Leonard
item.description: "In the cellars of the night, when the mind starts moving around old trunks of bad times, the pain of this and the same of that, the memory of a small boldness is a hand to hold." -- John Leonard

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Louis-Ferdinand Celine
item.description: "To hell with reality! I want to die in music, not in reason or in prose. People don't deserve the restraint we show by not going into delirium in front of them. To hell with them!" -- Louis-Ferdinand Celine

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "You are what you do, not what you say you'll do." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Listen--are you breathing just a little, and calling it a life?" -- Mary Oliver
